. The municipality of Kungsbacka has around 74 000 inhabitants and the city has around 10 500 inhabitants.

;By plane
From the Landvetter and Gothenburg City airports, the airport bus to Gothenburg (going directly from the airport building, ticket by creditcard from driver) and then train is preferred. From Copenhagen airport, Öresundståg trains go directly from the arrival area to Kungsbacka (3 hours travel time).

;By train
Between Gothenburg and Kungsbacka there are
trains. From Copenhagen, Malmö, Halmstad and cities in between, use the

trains. The train station is located in central Kungsbacka.

;By bus
There are

buses to the coast of Kungsbacka municipality, e.g. Särö, but if going to Kungsbacka use the train.

;By car
Use the E6 highway. From Landvetter airport follow the roads 40 and E6.

value: , a mansion built 1898-1904, approx 10kms south of Kungsbacka. It is located on a peninsula in the Kungsbacka Fjord on the Kattegat coast. Tjoloholm Castle was designed in the Arts and Crafts style by architect Lars Israel Wahlmann. There are guided tours in English in the summer months.

is a large shopping centre with around 90 stores.

value: content=Dining and entertainment. Serves modern renditions of traditional Swedish food, DJ music on certain nights. Mains start at around 200 SEK.
